meanings.definition: Lie or crawl on the ground face down, showing submission or fear.
meanings.sent1: The dog would grovel before its owner when scolded.
meanings.sent2: She had to grovel in the mud during the obstacle course.
meanings.sent3: The toddler decided to grovel on the floor during playtime.
meanings.sent4: The defeated warrior had to grovel in defeat before the conqueror.
meanings.sent5: The beggar had to grovel for coins in the busy street.

meanings.definition: Act in an obsequious manner in order to obtain forgiveness or favor.
meanings.sent1: He would grovel to his boss for a promotion.
meanings.sent2: She didn't want to grovel to her friend for forgiveness.
meanings.sent3: The politician had to grovel to the voters for support.
meanings.sent4: The student had to grovel to the teacher for a better grade.
meanings.sent5: The employee had to grovel to the manager for a day off.
